content: In a table of US cities and their respective plastic bag legislation, which two cities were the first to pass laws banning the use of plastic bags? The table includes the following columns: City, State, Date of Legislation, and Type of Ban (Full or Partial).

The first two U.S. cities to pass laws banning the use of plastic bags were San Francisco, California, and Oakland, California. San Francisco was the pioneer, enacting its plastic bag ban in 2007. Oakland followed shortly after, implementing a similar ban in 2007 as well. Both cities implemented full bans on the use of plastic bags in certain types of stores, setting a precedent for other cities and states to follow.
